article.headline: UC Santa Barbara 65, Pepperdine 56
article.story: SANTA BARBARA (AP) -- Cecil Brown, scoring a career-high 28 points, rallied UC Santa Barbara from a nine-point deficit for a 65-56 victory over Pepperdine Wednesday. Brown made half of the Gauchos' shots, going 11-for-17. That included three-of-six from the three-point line. UCSB (3-3) shot 42.3 percent overall. Tashaan Forehan-Kelly finished with 21 points for the Waves (1-5), making four-of-five from the three-point arc. His three-pointer and four free throws gave Pepperdine a 21-12 lead with 8:11 left in the first half. However, UCSB's Brown scored 26 points the rest of the way, which included a long three-pointer at the halftime buzzer to tie the game at 27-all. Glenn Turner scored nine of his career-high 13 points in the second half to help UCSB pull away for the victory. Jarrad Henry led Pepperdine's 44-34 rebound advantage by grabbing nine missed shots but he fouled out with just under six minutes to go.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
